sentences.english: Jesus replied, "Moses permitted you to divorce your wives because your hearts were hard.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌說，摩西因爲你們的心硬，所以許你們休妻。

sentences.english: Why do you make your hearts hard, like the hearts of Pharaoh and the Egyptians?
sentences.chinese: 你們爲什麼像埃及人和法郎一樣心硬呢？

sentences.english: With heart-piercing accuracy, Jesus states that hard-heartedness causes marriage breakdown.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌一針見血地指出，是人的心硬導致了婚姻破裂。

sentences.english: And Jesus answered and said unto them, For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌說，摩西因爲你們的心硬，所以寫這條例給你們。

sentences.english: They have become hardened by sin and the truth has no chance of entering.
sentences.chinese: 罪使他們心硬，真理無法進到他們心內。

sentences.english: Simon the cold heart was a Pharisee.
sentences.chinese: 西門是一個心硬的法利賽人。

definition: to have a heart of stone/hard-hearted/unfeeling
heart/intention/one's inclination/state of mind/to have the heart for sth/mood
to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
lit. eats soft food, but refuses hard food (idiom)/amenable to coaxing but not coercion
susceptible to force but not persuasion
completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom); cold and ruthless
see 刀子嘴，豆腐心[dao1 zi5 zui3 , dou4 fu5 xin1]
